e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards of transparency and integrity in financial reporting. While there may be short-term confusion among investors, establishing a clear and unbiased reporting practice will enhance the company's credibility and reduce legal risks in the long run, benefiting both the firm and its shareholders.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness in financial disclosures. This includes providing clear, unbiased information that reflects the true financial health of the company, enabling investors to make well-informed decisions. It should also consider the potential impact on all stakeholders, promoting trust and accountability. Consistent alignment with legal regulations and industry standards is crucial to avoid future liabilities and maintain the firm's reputation.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors effectively and what measures will be taken to mitigate any potential confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about their strategy for educating retail investors on the implications of the new policy and ensuring ongoing transparency in future financial communications.
